abstracts.abstract:
Existing law provides for various memorials and monuments on the grounds of the State Capitol. Existing law requires the Department of General Services to maintain state buildings and grounds.

This bill would authorize a nonprofit organization representing Sons of the American Revolution and Daughters of the American Revolution, in consultation with the Department of General Services, to plan, construct, and maintain a monument to California's 250th Anniversary on the grounds of the State Capitol. The bill would require the nonprofit organization to submit a plan for the monument to the Joint Rules Committee for its review and approval. The bill would require the monument to be funded exclusively from private sources.

actions.description: Introduced. Read first time. To Com. on RLS. for assignment. To print.

extras.impact_clause: An act to add Section 14638.2 to the Government Code, relating to the State Capitol.
